Detailed Description

An Exception class for representing Ionic server-side errors.

When an SDK call communicates with an Ionic server, it is possible that the server incurs an error, rejects the data it receives, etc. In that case, the SDK throws a ServerException in order to indicate both the SDK-specific error data as well as any server-specific error data. The server-specific error data can be helpful in determining why the communication failed.

For example, when decrypting content via GenericFileCipher::Encrypt(), the SDK communicates with an Ionic server in order to retrieve keys. If the server incurs an error, then the SDK will throw a ServerException to indicate the error data returned by the server (if any).

See more information about handling Ionic errors at .NET SDK Exceptions Overview

Constructor & Destructor Documentation

◆ ServerException() [1/4]

IonicSecurity::SDK::ServerException::ServerException ( int  nSdkErr,
int  nHttpCode,
int  nServerCode,
String ^  sServerMessage,
String ^  sServerDataJson,
String ^  sConversationId 
)

Initializes the exception with a C++ SDK error code.

Parameters
[in]nSdkErrThe C++ SDK error code.
[in]nHttpCodeThe HTTP response code.
[in]nServerCodeThe internal server error code. Provide zero if none was provided by the server.
[in]sServerMessageThe internal server error message. Provide null or empty string if none was provided by the server.
[in]sServerDataJsonThe internal server error data JSON. Provide null or empty string if none was provided by the server.
[in]sConversationIdThe conversation ID generated by the client for use in the server request.
